ProteinName	Supervillin (Archvillin) (p205/p250)
GeneName	SVIL
Length	1788
Function	Forms a high-affinity link between the actin cytoskeleton and the membrane. Is among the first costameric proteins to assemble during myogenesis and it contributes to myogenic membrane structure and differentiation (PubMed:12711699). Appears to be involved in myosin II assembly. May modulate myosin II regulation through MLCK during cell spreading, an initial step in cell migration. May play a role in invadopodial function (PubMed:19109420).
Subcellular Location	Cell membrane; Cytoplasm; Cytoskeleton; Cell projection; Invadopodium; Cell projection; Podosome; Midbody; Cleavage furrow
